Bio

Pedro Augusto de Souza Bergamo was born in Franca, a small city of shoemakers in the interior of Brazil. He was named after his maternal grandfather, who was a santero and raised by his mom and step-father. He is a biological son of Pedro Bergamo and nephew of Antonio Bergamo from the Sertanejo duo "Canário e Passarinho" .

His musical journey started at a presbyterian church playing acoustic guitar and singing, but his curiosity and hard temper led him to quit the church and start composing metal and hard rock music. In his youth, beside cover gigs, he played and sang in original rock bands from Franca alternative scene.

Some years later, his father presented him a "viola caipira", a Brazilian traditional instrument, which he showed little interest until his cousin played "O último condor" by Almir Sater on it. Since then, he started to compose music in Portuguese, influenced by Brazilian singer-songwriters like Almir Sater and Zé Ramalho.

Around that time, a friend was putting together a magician act and needed original music. He wrote and performed a set of original songs in Portuguese for the act "O Fantástico Circo de Aracnídea". The debut show was a flop. In one of the rehearsals, though, one magician explained to him the chemistry behind a certain magic trick, which ignited his curiosity for the subject.

Putting music aside for a while, he earned a Master's Degree in computational chemistry from Universidade de Franca, and published his scientific contributions in "Journal of Luminescence", "Chemical Physics", "Journal of Physical Chemistry C" and "Natural Products Communications" . After teaching chemistry for one year, he moved to Finland to pursue a Ph.D..

After 2 years living in Finland, he met the Finnish producer Joel Lindfors, which produced and released his compositions "Lago Brasil" and "Nós dois merecemos viver".

2020 was a hard year, since he lost someone dear due to suicide. While visiting Brazil, he took confort in the work of "Ariano Suassuna", and produced songs from the "O Fantástico Circo de Aracnídea" infamous show, using only Brazilian instruments at OctoSonus Studios-São Paulo, owned by Laio Garcia, his childhood friend. The songs were "Abrahadabra", "Flores pelo céu" and "Feiticeiro Esteve Aqui".

By returning to Finland, he joined the Latin band "La orquesta del fin del mundo", where he met Rolando, Satu and Seppo. After a rearrangement of the band, he quitted and formed "Pedro Bergamo & Los Santeros" with some of the integrants. The result is a mixture of sertanejo, Finnish folk and progressive rock.

Line-up:

Pedro Bergamo - Acoustic Guitar & Vocals

Satu Lankinen - Accordion & Vocals

Rolando Camilo - Drums & Vocals

Seppo Salmi - Electric Guitar
